titleStmt.title: James Cutberth to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5845

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his exelence thomas Bramblet govenor of the commonwealth of Kentucky your petitioner James Cutberth wold Respectible represent to your Excelence that he was indited by the granjury at the March Terme of the Whilley Circuit courte and Judgment Rendered by the courte against him for failing as a tavern Keeper to set up his tavern Rates and Judment was Rendered against him for Seventy five dollars he states that he had no intention of violating the law and that he got out licens to Keepe the tavrn and he sasked after paying the state price if that was all and he was informed that it was all that he had to do and that he in good faith went on and sold faile to put up the Raites and did not know it was Requird of him he say he knowes but litle a bout law and has but litle to do in law maters he says that he is a law abiding citizen and has never gave aid to the Rebelion and that he now has two sones in the servis and the an of the govrnment and the onley ones he has he prays your Excelence to Remite the fine and to set aside the Judgement and for all Proper Releaf
sworn to before me by J Cutberth this Sept the 27 day of 1864
The under signed says that they beleave it wold be an act chairty to Remite the fine and askes that it be Remited and beleaves that cutberth acted in good faith & was Igrant of the Law

signers names
signers names
John Smith
D H Leforce
W. C. Watkins
J. L. Gatliffe
S. P. Brawner
H F Finely

Whitley Cir Ct
vs
Jas Cutberth
$75 --
Remit
4th Oct/64
